alert.note: Alert for Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 11:54PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield...eastern Washington...northwestern Kane and southeastern Iron Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1153 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cedar Breaks National Monument, or 9 miles southeast of Cedar City, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar City, Enoch, Parowan, Hatch, Cedar Breaks National Monument, Panguitch Lake, Summit, Brian Head and Hamilton Fort. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 54 and 74. US Route 89 between mile markers 106 and 118. Utah Route 56 between mile markers 55 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys
